page.title: 10ODD FACTS ON THE OLD COURSE
page.content: The hump-backed stone bridge over the Swilken burn, on the 18th fairway is the oldest structure in St.Andrews which has been in constant use. It is thought to be 800 years old and was once the only link between the town and the safe harbour in the Eden Estuary. The Old Course originally had 22 holes and began and ended at the top of the hill near St.James' Church. Only in 1836, when the R.& A.was given a site for their clubhouse, was it reduced to 18 holes. When The Captain of the R.& A."plays himself in", each September, at the start of his year of office, he drives a ball from the 1st Tee and all the caddies race to retrieve it. The winner receives a gold sovereign which now has to be minted specially for the R.& A.
